result.execSummary:
The defendant Marshall Tc Ballenger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay all costs, assessments, victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.  
AS TO ALL COURT COSTS/SURCHARGES/RESTITUTION:  To be paid from 25% of prison account under SEc. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

**01-15-15/ Jeffrey A Wagner**
The Court ordered the JOC amended to state that the defendant is NOTELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program and NOT ELIGIBLE for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  Defendant is statutorily ineligible for these programs due to his conviction under Chapter 940. Stats.

superMiscConds.notes: Register as a sex offender. Sex offender assessment and treatment.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Defendant advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor; and that his voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

Hearing 11/2/2014.
**11/6/2014  $1,938.60 payable to Jeff and Susan F.; and $85.00 payable to Crime Victim Compensation Fund.  DOC to collect from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

AMENDING Judgment of Conviction signed and filed.
The judgment of conviction shall be amended to state the defendant is not eligible for the CIP and no eligible for SAP.  The defendant is statutorily imeligible for these programs due to his conviction under Chapter 940, Stats.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, for review. mag

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Scott Alan Wales in court, defendant Marshall Tc Ballenger not in court, in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is incarcerated at Dodge Correctional.
Parties have reached a resolution as to restitution.
The court orders restitution as follows: $1938.60 payable to Jeff and Susan F. and $85.00 payable to Crime Victim Compensation Fund.
-The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Defendant Marshall Tc Ballenger in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.  Defendant does not stipulate to restitution; matter set for hearing on 11-6-2014 at 8:15.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.   Additional statements by Susan F., Jeffrey F.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 78 MONTHS  in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 1 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 30 MONTHS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 48 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-Register as a sex offender.
-Sex offender assessment and treatment.
-AODA.
-No contact with victim, JF
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant remanded.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
character references filed by defense.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1:  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 38.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 10-24-2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Marshall Tc Ballenger in court with attorney Scott A. Wales.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
charging: THIRD DEGREE SEXUAL ASSAULT, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.225(3), 939.50(3)(g), a Class G Felony.

Defendant Marshall Tc Ballenger in court with attorney Scott A. Wales.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter was previously set for plea and the defendant now wishes a trial.  Court is advised that a miranda hearing will not be needed.  Case set for final pretrial on 9-22-2014 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 10-6-2014 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions and discovery to be filed by 8-12-2014.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 07-22-2014 at 08:15 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Wagner, Br. 38.

Deputy clerk contacted Branch 38; Branch 38 requests case be adjourned for scheduling conference.
Court orders case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 38.

Case scheduled for jury trial.  Discussion regarding DNA issue and the analysis not being available to testify today. Attorney Scott A Wales in court.  Erin M Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case scheduled for motion hearing at 1:30 pm today.  Br 12 is in a long trial and will not able to hear the motion today. Court will hear the motion on the day of trial.  Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 6/23/2014 at 8:30 a.m.   Case is adjourned to Br 12.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Branch 12, Judge David Borowski presiding.  Arraignment scheduled for March 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
